Module jGame
Package jGame.core.ui

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • jGame.core.ui.Window
  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    The default class for presenting displays on the screen. The default resolution is Full HD (1920x1080), so the dimensions of the window frame are automatically adjusted based on the screen resolution, so the user has the impression of the window being the same size on any screen resolution.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Nuno Pereira
    See Also:
    WindowUtils

    • Constructor Detail

      • Window

        public Window​(int width,
              int height,
              java.lang.CharSequence title)
        Instantiates a window object to be displayed. The constructor calls doSyncUIUpdate(Runnable) with a lambda expression containing init(int, int, CharSequence), moving the window initialization to the AWT Event Thread.

        The actual dimensions of the window wont be the ones passed in to the constructor, but rather scaled based of the screen size relative to the default size.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the window
        height - the height of the window
        title - the title of the window
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        WindowUtils, WindowUtils.HORIZONTAL_SCALE, WindowUtils.VERTICAL_SCALE

      • init

        private void init​(int width,
                  int height,
                  java.lang.CharSequence title)
        Initializes the window with the given width, height and title. This method is called on the AWT Event Thread.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the window
        height - the height of the window
        title - the title of the window
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        Window(int, int, CharSequence)

      • doAsyncUIUpdate

        public void doAsyncUIUpdate​(java.lang.Runnable r)

        Parameters:

        Since:

        See Also:

      • doSyncUIUpdate

        public void doSyncUIUpdate​(java.lang.Runnable r)
                    throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                           java.lang.InterruptedException
        Queues a Runnable to run synchronously on the AWT Event Thread.
        Parameters:
        r - the instance of Runnable
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if we're interrupted while waiting for the event dispatching thread to finish executing r.run()
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if an exception is thrown while running r
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        doAsyncUIUpdate(Runnable), SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait(Runnable)
